The interim third-party expenses return shall include a declaration that the return is accurate signed by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party’s financial agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if different from the financial agent, the person who signed the application made under subsection 349.6(2).

Subsection.Text: A third party shall, at the request of the Chief Electoral Officer, provide documents evidencing expenses set out in the return that are in an amount of more than $50, including bank statements, deposit slips and cancelled cheques.

Every third party that is required to be registered in accordance with subsection 349.6(1) shall file an interim third-party expenses return in the prescribed form with the Chief Electoral Officer on September 15, if the third party

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has incurred expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(1) in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more during the period beginning on the day after polling day at the general election previous to the pre-election period and ending on the earlier of September 14 and the last day of the pre-election period; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has received contributions in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes during the period referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: Subsections 349.91(2) to (10) apply to the return under subsection (1), except that a reference to the period referred to in paragraph (1)(a) of section 349.91 shall be read as a reference to the period referred to in paragraph (1)(a) of this section.

In addition to the exceptions set out in subsection 349.91(5), the interim third-party expenses return need not include any information referred to in subsections 349.91(2) and (4) that was included in an interim third-party expenses return that the third party previously filed under subsection 349.91(1).
This section applies only in the case of a general election that is held on a day set in accordance with subsection 56.1(2) or section 56.2.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — false, misleading or incomplete return
Section.Text: No third party shall file under subsection 349.91(1) or 349.92(1) an interim third-party expenses return that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party knows or ought reasonably to know contains a material statement that is false or misleading; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not substantially set out the information required under section 349.91 or 349.92, as the case may be.

Section.Text: No third party shall use a contribution made for partisan activity, partisan advertising or election survey purposes for the purpose of any of the following if the third party does not know the name and address of the contributor or is otherwise unable to determine within which class of contributor referred to in subsection 349.91(7) the contributor falls:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a partisan activity that is carried out during a pre-election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a partisan advertising message that is transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an election survey that is conducted during that period and whose results the third party takes into account in its decisions concerning whether or not to organize and carry out partisan activities during that period or to transmit partisan advertising messages during that period.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Partisan Activities, Election Advertising and Election Surveys During Election Period

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 351.1, a third party shall not incur the following expenses in an aggregate amount of more than $350,000:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partisan activity expenses in relation to partisan activities that are carried out during the election period of a general election;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: election advertising expenses in relation to election advertising messages that are transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: election survey expenses in relation to election surveys that are conducted during that period.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum election period expenses — electoral district
Subsection.Text: Not more than $3,000 of the maximum amount referred to in subsection (1) shall be incurred to promote or oppose the election of one or more candidates in a given electoral district.

The maximum amount set out in subsection (2) only applies to an amount incurred with respect to a leader of a registered party or eligible party to the extent that it is incurred to promote or oppose his or her election in an electoral district.
Subject to section 351.1, a third party shall not incur the following expenses in an aggregate amount of more than $3,000 in a given electoral district:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partisan activity expenses in relation to partisan activities that are carried out during the election period of a by-election;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: election advertising expenses in relation to election advertising messages that are transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: election survey expenses in relation to election surveys that are conducted during that period.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a general election that is not held on a day set in accordance with subsection 56.1(2) or section 56.2, or of a by-election, a third party is deemed not to have incurred a partisan activity expense, an election advertising expense or an election survey expense if, on the issue of the writ or writs, it is not able to cancel the activity, the transmission of the advertising message or the survey, as the case may be, that the expense is in relation to.
The amounts referred to in subsections (1), (2) and (4) shall be multiplied by the inflation adjustment factor referred to in section 384 that is in effect on the issue of the writ or writs.

Section.Text: A third party shall not circumvent, or attempt to circumvent, a maximum amount set out in section 350 in any manner, including by splitting itself into two or more third parties for the purpose of circumventing the maximum amount or acting in collusion with another third party so that their combined partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses exceed the maximum amount.

Subsection.Text: No third party and no registered party shall act in collusion with each other — including by sharing information — in order to influence the third party in its partisan activities that it carries out during an election period, its election advertising or its election surveys that it conducts or causes to be conducted during an election period.

No third party and no candidate shall act in collusion with each other — including by sharing information — in order to influence the third party in its partisan activities that it carries out during an election period, its election advertising or its election surveys that it conducts or causes to be conducted during an election period.

No third party and no person associated with a candidate’s campaign — including a candidate’s official agent — shall act in collusion with each other — including by sharing information — in order to influence the third party in its partisan activities that it carries out during an election period, its election advertising or its election surveys that it conducts or causes to be conducted during an election period.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — spending by foreign third parties

Subsection.Text: A foreign third party shall not incur the following expenses:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partisan activity expenses in relation to a partisan activity that is carried out during an election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: election advertising expenses in relation to an election advertising message that is transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: election survey expenses in relation to an election survey that is conducted during that period.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (1), a foreign third party is a third party in respect of which

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is an individual, the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is not a Canadian citizen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not reside in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is a corporation or entity,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it does not carry on business in Canada, or its primary purpose in Canada during an election period is to influence electors during that period to vote or refrain from voting, or to vote or refrain from voting for a particular candidate or registered party, at the election, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it was incorporated, formed or otherwise organized outside Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is a group, no person who is responsible for the group

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is a Canadian citizen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: resides in Canada.

Section.Text: A third party shall include — in a manner that is clearly visible or otherwise accessible — in any election advertising message placed by it its name, its telephone number, either its civic or its Internet address and an indication in or on the message that it has authorized its transmission.

Subsection.Text: A third party shall register immediately after having incurred the following expenses in an aggregate amount of $500:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partisan activity expenses in relation to partisan activities that are carried out during an election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: election advertising expenses in relation to election advertising messages that are transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: election survey expenses in relation to election surveys that are conducted during that period.

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: However, the third party may not register before the issue of the writ.

Subsection.Text: A third party that registered under subsection 349.6(1) during a pre-election period that ends the day before the day of the issue of the writ and that is also required to register under subsection (1) is deemed to be registered under that subsection (1).
An application for registration shall be sent to the Chief Electoral Officer in the prescribed form and shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is an individual, the individual’s name, address and telephone number, their signature and their declaration that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are a Canadian citizen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they are a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: they reside in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is a corporation, the name, address and telephone number of the corporation and of an officer who has signing authority for it, the officer’s signature and their declaration that the corporation carries on business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is a group, the name, address and telephone number of the group and of a person who is responsible for the group, the person’s signature and their declaration that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are a Canadian citizen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they are a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: they reside in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address and telephone number of the third party’s office where its books and records are kept and of the office in Canada to which communications may be addressed and at which documents may be served; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the third party’s financial agent.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Declaration of financial agent to accompany application
Subsection.Text: An application under subsection (2) must be accompanied by a declaration signed by the financial agent accepting the appointment.

If a third party’s financial agent is replaced, it shall, without delay, provide the Chief Electoral Officer with the new financial agent’s name, address and telephone number and a declaration signed by the new financial agent accepting the appointment.

If the third party is a trade union, corporation or other entity with a governing body, the application shall include a copy of a resolution passed by its governing body authorizing it to incur partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses.

The Chief Electoral Officer shall, without delay after receiving an application, determine whether the requirements set out in subsections (1) to (3) and (5) are met and shall then notify the person who signed the application whether the third party is registered. In the case of a refusal to register, the Chief Electoral Officer shall give reasons for the refusal.

A third party may not be registered under a name that, in the opinion of the Chief Electoral Officer, is likely to be confused with the name of a candidate, registered party, registered third party or eligible party.

The registration of a third party is valid only for the election period during which the application is made, but the third party continues to be subject to the requirement to file a third-party expenses return under subsection 359(1).

A third party that is required to register under subsection 353(1) shall appoint a financial agent who may be a person who is authorized to sign an application for registration made under that subsection.

If, at the end of the pre-election period before a general election referred to in paragraph 353(1)(a), a third party has a financial agent who was appointed under subsection 349.7(1), the financial agent is deemed to have been appointed under subsection (1).
The following persons are not eligible to be a financial agent of a third party:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a candidate or an official agent of a candidate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is the chief agent, or a registered agent, of a registered party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an election officer or a member of the staff of a returning officer; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is not a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident within the meaning of subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

Subsection.Text: A third party that is required to register under subsection 353(1) shall appoint an auditor without delay if it incurs the following expenses in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partisan activity expenses in respect of partisan activities that take place during an election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: election advertising expenses in respect of election advertising messages that are transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: election survey expenses in relation to that period.

Subsection.Text: If, when the obligation under subsection (1) to appoint an auditor applies, a third party has an auditor who was appointed under subsection 349.8(1), the auditor is deemed to have been appointed under subsection (1).
The following are eligible to be an auditor for a third party:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member in good standing of a corporation, an association or an institute of professional accountants; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a partnership every partner of which is a member in good standing of a corporation, an association or an institute of professional accountants.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are not eligible to be an auditor for a third party:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party’s financial agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who signed the application made under subsection 353(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an election officer or a member of the staff of a returning officer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a candidate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the official agent of a candidate;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the chief agent of a registered party or an eligible party; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a registered agent of a registered party.

Subsection.Text: Every third party, without delay after an auditor is appointed, must provide the Chief Electoral Officer with the auditor’s name, address, telephone number and occupation and a signed declaration accepting the appointment.

If a third party’s auditor is replaced, it must, without delay, provide the Chief Electoral Officer with the new auditor’s name, address, telephone number and occupation and a signed declaration accepting the appointment.

Every contribution made during an election period to a registered third party for partisan activity, election advertising or election survey purposes shall be accepted by its financial agent, and every partisan activity expense, election advertising expense and election survey expense incurred during an election period on behalf of a registered third party shall be authorized by its financial agent.

A financial agent may authorize a person to accept contributions or to authorize the incurring of partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses or election survey expenses, but that authorization does not limit the financial agent’s responsibility.

Every third party that is required to be registered in accordance with subsection 353(1) shall file an interim third-party expenses return in the prescribed form with the Chief Electoral Officer on the 21st day before polling day, if the third party

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was required to file an interim third-party expenses return with the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 349.92(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has incurred expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(1) or 350(1) in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more during the period beginning on the day after polling day at the previous general election and ending on the 23rd day before polling day; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received contributions in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes during the period referred to in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: The interim third-party expenses return shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a general election that is held on a day set in accordance with subsection 56.1(2) or section 56.2,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan activity expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan advertising expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date and place of the transmission of the partisan advertising messages to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election survey expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date of the election surveys to which the expenses relate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses and election survey expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(1) — other than those referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii) — and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the partisan activity expenses relate, the date and place of the transmission of the partisan advertising messages to which the partisan advertising expenses relate and the date of the election surveys to which the election survey expenses relate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any general election,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan activity expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election advertising expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date and place of the transmission of the election advertising messages to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election survey expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date of the election surveys to which the expenses relate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses referred to in subsection 350(1) other than those referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the partisan activity expenses relate, the date and place of the transmission of the election advertising messages to which the election advertising expenses relate and the date of the election surveys to which the election survey expenses relate.

Subsection.Text: If a third party has not incurred expenses referred to in subsection (2), that fact shall be indicated in its interim third-party expenses return.
The interim third-party expenses return shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount, by class of contributor, of contributions for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes that were received during the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph (c), for each contributor who made contributions of a total amount of more than $200 for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes during the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b), their name, address and class, and the amount and date of each contribution;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a numbered company that is a contributor referred to in paragraph (b), the name of the chief executive officer or president of that company; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount, other than an amount of a contribution referred to in paragraph (a), that was paid out of the third party’s own funds during the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b) for partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses, election advertising expenses or election survey expenses.

Subsection.Text: The interim third-party expenses return need not include any information referred to in subsections (2) and (4) that was included in a third-party expenses return that the third party previously filed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 359(1) in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a by-election that was held after the general election referred to in paragraph (1)(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a general election for which the third party incurred expenses or received contributions between the day fixed under paragraph 57(1.2)(c) for polling day at the general election and polling day in an electoral district in which the election was postponed under subsection 59(4) or 77(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 349.91(1) or 349.92(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (4), a contribution includes a loan.
For the purposes of paragraphs (4)(a) and (b), the following are the classes of contributor:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: individuals;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: businesses;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: commercial organizations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: governments;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: trade unions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: corporations without share capital other than trade unions; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: unincorporated organizations or associations other than trade unions.

Subsection.Text: If the third party is unable to identify which contributions were received during the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b) for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes, the interim third-party expenses return shall include, subject to paragraph (4)(c), the names and addresses of every contributor who contributed a total of more than $200 to it during that period.
The interim third-party expenses return shall include a declaration that the return is accurate signed by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party’s financial agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if different from the financial agent, the person who signed the application made under subsection 349.6(2) or 353(2), as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: A third party shall, at the request of the Chief Electoral Officer, provide documents evidencing expenses set out in the return that are in an amount of more than $50, including bank statements, deposit slips and cancelled cheques.

Every third party that is required to be registered in accordance with subsection 353(1) shall file an interim third-party expenses return in the prescribed form with the Chief Electoral Officer on the 7th day before polling day, if the third party

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was required to file an interim third-party expenses return with the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 349.92(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has incurred expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(1) or 350(1) in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more during the period beginning on the day after polling day at the previous general election and ending on the 9th day before polling day; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received contributions in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes during the period referred to in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: Subsections 357.01(2) to (10) apply to the return under subsection (1), except that a reference to the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b) of section 357.01 shall be read as a reference to the period referred to in paragraph (1)(b) of this section.

In addition to the exceptions set out in subsection 357.01(5), the interim third-party expenses return need not include any information referred to in subsections 357.01(2) and (4) that was included in an interim third-party expenses return that the third party previously filed under subsection 357.01(1).

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — false, misleading or incomplete return
Section.Text: No third party shall file under subsection 357.01(1) or 357.02(1) an interim third-party expenses return that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party knows or ought reasonably to know contains a material statement that is false or misleading; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not substantially set out the information required under section 357.01 or 357.02, as the case may be.

Section.Text: No third party shall use a contribution for the purpose of any of the following if the third party does not know the name and address of the contributor or is otherwise unable to determine within which class of contributor referred to in subsection 359(6) the contributor falls:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a partisan activity that is carried out during an election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an election advertising message that is transmitted during that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an election survey that is conducted during that period and whose results the third party takes into account in its decisions concerning whether or not to organize and carry out partisan activities during that period or to transmit election advertising messages during that period.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3
Heading.TitleText: Third Parties’ Bank Accounts, Registry of Third Parties and Third-Party Expenses Returns

Subsection.Text: A third party that is required to register under subsection 349.6(1) — or under subsection 353(1), if it was not required to register under subsection 349.6(1) — shall open a separate bank account for the sole purpose of its partisan activities that are carried out or to be carried out during a pre-election period or an election period, partisan advertising, election advertising and election surveys.

The account shall be in a Canadian financial institution as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, or in an authorized foreign bank as defined in that section that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) of that Act.

All of the third party’s financial transactions in relation to its partisan activities referred to in subsection (1), partisan advertising, election advertising and election surveys that involve the payment or receipt of money are to be paid from or deposited to the account.
After polling day, the third party shall close the account once all unpaid claims and any outstanding balance have been dealt with.
The third party shall, on closing the account, provide the Chief Electoral Officer with the final statement of the account.

Section.Text: The Chief Electoral Officer shall maintain, for the period that he or she considers appropriate, a registry of registered third parties in which is recorded, in relation to each one, the information referred to in subsections 349.6(2), 349.8(4) and (5), 353(2) and 355(4) and (5).

Subsection.Text: Every third party that is required to be registered in accordance with subsection 349.6(1) or 353(1) shall file a third-party expenses return in the prescribed form with the Chief Electoral Officer within four months after polling day.
The third-party expenses return shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a general election that is held on a day set in accordance with subsection 56.1(2) or section 56.2,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan activity expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan advertising expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date and place of the transmission of the partisan advertising messages to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election survey expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(2) and the date of the election surveys to which the expenses relate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses and election survey expenses referred to in subsection 349.1(1) — other than those referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii) — and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the partisan activity expenses relate, the date and place of the transmission of the partisan advertising messages to which the partisan advertising expenses relate and the date of the election surveys to which the election survey expenses relate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any general election,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of partisan activity expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election advertising expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date and place of the transmission of the election advertising messages to which the expenses relate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of election survey expenses referred to in subsection 350(2) and the date of the election surveys to which the expenses relate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of all partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses referred to in subsection 350(1) other than those referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the partisan activity expenses relate, the date and place of the transmission of the election advertising messages to which the election advertising expenses relate and the date of the election surveys to which the election survey expenses relate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a by-election, a list of partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses referred to in subsection 350(4) and the date and place of the partisan activities to which the partisan activity expenses relate, the date and place of the transmission of the election advertising messages to which the election advertising expenses relate and the date of the election surveys to which the election survey expenses relate.

Subsection.Text: If a third party has not incurred expenses referred to in paragraph (2)(a), (b) or (c), that fact shall be indicated in its third-party expenses return.
The third-party expenses return shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount, by class of contributor, of contributions for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes that were received during the period beginning the day after polling day at the general election previous to the polling day referred to in subsection (1) and ending on that polling day referred to in that subsection;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph (b.1), for each contributor who made contributions of a total amount of more than $200 for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes during the period referred to in paragraph (a), their name, address and class, and the amount and date of each contribution;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a numbered company that is a contributor referred to in paragraph (b), the name of the chief executive officer or president of that company; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount, other than an amount of a contribution referred to in paragraph (a), that was paid out of the third party’s own funds for partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses, election advertising expenses or election survey expenses.

Subsection.Text: The third-party expenses return need not include any information referred to in subsection (4) that was included in a third-party expenses return that the third party previously filed under subsection (1) in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a by-election that was held after the general election referred to in paragraph (4)(a); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a general election for which the third party incurred expenses or received contributions between the day fixed under paragraph 57(1.2)(c) for polling day at the general election and polling day in an electoral district in which the election was postponed under subsection 59(4) or 77(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (4), a contribution includes a loan.
For the purposes of paragraphs (4)(a) and (b), the following are the classes of contributor:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: individuals;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: businesses;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: commercial organizations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: governments;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: trade unions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: corporations without share capital other than trade unions; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: unincorporated organizations or associations other than trade unions.

Subsection.Text: If the third party is unable to identify which contributions were received during the period referred to in paragraph (4)(a) for partisan activity, partisan advertising, election advertising or election survey purposes, the third-party expenses return shall include, subject to paragraph (4)(b.1), the names and addresses of every contributor who contributed a total of more than $200 to it during that period.
A third-party expenses return shall include a declaration that the return is accurate signed by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party’s financial agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if different from the financial agent, the person who signed the application made under subsection 353(2) or — if subsection 353(1.1) applies — 349.6(2).

Subsection.Text: A third party shall, at the request of the Chief Electoral Officer, provide documents evidencing expenses set out in the return that are in an amount of more than $50, including bank statements, deposit slips and cancelled cheques.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — false, misleading or incomplete document
Section.Text: No third party shall file under subsection 359(1) a third-party expenses return that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third party knows or ought reasonably to know contains a material statement that is false or misleading; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not substantially set out the information required under section 359.

Subsection.Text: If a third party incurs partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses, election advertising expenses or election survey expenses in an aggregate amount of $10,000 or more, its third-party expenses return filed under subsection 359(1) shall include a report made under subsection (2).

The third party’s auditor shall report on the third-party expenses return and shall make any examination that will enable the auditor to give an opinion in the report as to whether the return presents fairly the information contained in the accounting records on which it is based.
An auditor shall include in the report any statement that the auditor considers necessary, when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the third-party expenses return that is the subject of the report does not present fairly the information contained in the accounting records on which it is based;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the auditor has not received from the third party all of the required information and explanation; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: based on the auditor’s examination, it appears that proper accounting records have not been kept by the third party.

Subsection.Text: The auditor shall have access at any reasonable time to all of the third party’s documents that, in the auditor’s opinion, are necessary to enable the auditor to prepare the report, and may require the third party to provide any information or explanation that, in the auditor’s opinion, is necessary to enable the auditor to prepare the report.
The Chief Electoral Officer may correct a third-party expenses return filed under subsection 359(1) if the correction does not materially affect its substance.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Corrections or revisions at request of Chief Electoral Officer
Subsection.Text: The Chief Electoral Officer may in writing request a third party to correct or revise, within a specified period, a third-party expenses return filed under subsection 359(1).
If the Chief Electoral Officer requests a correction or revision, the third party shall provide him or her with the corrected or revised version of the return within the specified period.

The Chief Electoral Officer, on the written application of a third party, shall authorize the extension of the period referred to in subsection 359(1) unless he or she is satisfied that the third party’s failure to file the third-party expenses return under that subsection was deliberate or was the result of the third party’s failure to exercise due diligence.
The application may be made within the period referred to in subsection 359(1) or within two weeks after the end of that period.

Section.MarginalNote: Corrections or revisions — Chief Electoral Officer

Subsection.Text: The Chief Electoral Officer, on the written application of a third party, shall authorize the correction or revision of a third-party expenses return filed under subsection 359(1) if he or she is satisfied by the evidence submitted by the third party that the correction or revision is necessary in order for the requirements of this Act to be complied with.
The application shall be made immediately after the third party becomes aware of the need for correction or revision.

The third party shall provide the Chief Electoral Officer with the corrected or revised version of the return within 30 days after the day on which the correction or revision is authorized or within any extension of that period authorized under subsection (4) or (5).

The Chief Electoral Officer, on the written application of the third party made within two weeks after the end of the 30-day period referred to in subsection (3), shall authorize the extension of that period, unless he or she is satisfied that the third party’s failure to provide the corrected or revised version of the return was deliberate or was the result of the third party’s failure to exercise due diligence.

The Chief Electoral Officer, on the written application of the third party made within two weeks after the end of an extension authorized under subsection (4) or under this subsection, shall authorize the further extension of that period, unless he or she is satisfied that the third party’s failure to provide the corrected or revised version of the return was deliberate or was the result of the third party’s failure to exercise due diligence.
A third party may apply to a judge for an order

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: relieving the third party from the obligation to comply with a request referred to in subsection 361(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: authorizing an extension referred to in subsection 361.1(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: authorizing a correction or revision referred to in subsection 361.2(1).

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: The third party shall notify the Chief Electoral Officer that the application has been made.

Subsection.Text: The application may be made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under paragraph (1)(a), within the specified period referred to in subsection 361(2) or within the two weeks after the end of that period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under paragraph (1)(b), within two weeks after, as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if an application for an extension is not made to the Chief Electoral Officer within the period referred to in subsection 361.1(2), the end of the two-week period referred to in that subsection,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the rejection of an application for an extension made in accordance with section 361.1, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the end of the extended period referred to in subsection 361.1(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: under paragraph (1)(c), within two weeks after the rejection of an application for a correction or revision made in accordance with section 361.2.

Subsection.Text: The judge shall grant an order authorizing an extension unless the judge is satisfied that the third party’s failure to file the required third-party expenses return was deliberate or was the result of the third party’s failure to exercise due diligence.

The judge shall grant an order authorizing a correction or revision if the judge is satisfied by the evidence submitted by the third party that the correction or revision is necessary in order for the requirements of this Act to be complied with.
The order may require that the third party satisfy any condition that the judge considers necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Act.

Section.Text: The Chief Electoral Officer shall, in the manner he or she considers appropriate,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: publish the names and addresses of registered third parties, as they are registered;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: publish, as soon as feasible, returns filed under subsection 349.91(1), 349.92(1), 357.01(1) or 357.02(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publish, within one year after the issue of the writ, returns filed under subsection 359(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: publish, as soon as feasible, a corrected or revised version of a return filed under subsection 359(1) and published under paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: No person or entity other than an individual who is a Canadian citizen or is a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act shall make a contribution to a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant.

If a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant receives a contribution from an ineligible contributor, the chief agent of the registered party, the financial agent of the registered association, the official agent of the candidate or the financial agent of the nomination contestant or leadership contestant, as the case may be, shall, within 30 days after becoming aware of the ineligibility, return the contribution unused to the contributor or, if that is not possible, pay the amount of it — or, in the case of a non-monetary contribution, an amount of money equal to its commercial value — to the Chief Electoral Officer, who shall forward that amount to the Receiver General.

For greater certainty, contributions to and expenses of a provincial division of a registered party are contributions to and expenses of the party. Similarly, transfers of funds to or by the division are transfers to or by the party.

A provincial division of a registered party may appoint registered agents, subject to any terms and conditions that the appointment specifies. This Act applies to those agents as if they were registered agents appointed by the party under subsection 396(1).
Any money that is used for a nomination contestant’s, a candidate’s or a leadership contestant’s campaign out of their own funds is a contribution for the purposes of this Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusion — litigation expenses and personal expenses
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Act, any money that is used out of a nomination contestant’s, candidate’s or leadership contestant’s own funds to pay a litigation expense or personal expense is not a contribution if it has not been deposited into the bank account referred to in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 476.65(1), in the case of a nomination contestant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 477.46(1), in the case of a candidate; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 478.72(1), in the case of a leadership contestant.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusion for goods and services — registered parties, registered associations and candidates
Subsection.Text: A provision of goods or services is permitted and is not a contribution for the purposes of this Act if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered party to an electoral district association of the party or a candidate endorsed by the party;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered association to the registered party with which it is affiliated, another registered association of the party or a candidate endorsed by the party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered party or registered association to a nomination contestant or a leadership contestant in compliance with subsection 365(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: from a candidate endorsed by a registered party to the party or a registered association of the party;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: from a candidate to themselves in their capacity as a nomination contestant in respect of the same election; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a writ is deemed to be withdrawn under subsection 31(3) of the Parliament of Canada Act, from a candidate in an election that is cancelled to themselves in their capacity as a candidate in respect of the general election resulting from the dissolution of Parliament.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusion for funds — registered parties, registered associations and candidates
Subsection.Text: A transfer of funds is permitted and is not a contribution for the purposes of this Act if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered party to an electoral district association of the party;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered association to the registered party with which it is affiliated or another registered association of the party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: from a candidate endorsed by a registered party to the party or a registered association of the party;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: from a candidate to themselves in their capacity as a nomination contestant in respect of the same election; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a writ is deemed to be withdrawn under subsection 31(3) of the Parliament of Canada Act, from a candidate in an election that is cancelled to themselves in their capacity as a candidate in respect of the general election resulting from the dissolution of Parliament.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusion for funds other than trust funds — registered parties and registered associations
Subsection.Text: A transfer of funds, other than trust funds, is permitted and is not a contribution for the purposes of this Act if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered party to a candidate endorsed by the party; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered association to a candidate endorsed by the registered party with which the association is affiliated.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusion for funds — nomination contestants, leadership contestants and registered parties
Subsection.Text: A transfer of funds is permitted and is not a contribution for the purposes of this Act if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: from a nomination contestant of a registered party to the party, the registered association of the party that held the nomination contest or the official agent of the candidate endorsed by the party in the electoral district in which the nomination contest was held;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: from a leadership contestant of a registered party to the party or a registered association of the party; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: from a registered party to a leadership contestant out of funds from a directed contribution referred to in subsection 365(3).

Subsection.Text: The provision by an employer of a paid leave of absence to an employee for the purpose of allowing the employee to be a nomination contestant or candidate is not a contribution.
The payment by an individual during a year of fees of not more than $25 per year for a period of not more than five years for membership in a registered party is not a contribution.

For greater certainty, the payment by or on behalf of an individual of fees to attend an annual or biennial convention or leadership convention of a particular registered party is a contribution to that party.

No person or entity other than an individual who is a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act shall pay fees to attend an annual or biennial convention or leadership convention of a particular registered party, or pay fees on behalf of another individual for them to attend such a convention.

No registered party and no electoral district association of a registered party shall provide goods or services or transfer funds to a nomination contestant or a leadership contestant, unless the goods or services are offered equally to all contestants.

In this section, directed contribution means an amount that is all or part of a contribution made to a registered party and that the contributor requests in writing be transferred to a particular leadership contestant.

Subsection (1) does not apply to a directed contribution that is transferred by the registered party to the leadership contestant mentioned in the request if the party provides, with the amount transferred, a statement in the prescribed form setting out the name and address of the contributor, the amount and date of the contribution, the amount of the directed contribution, the amount that the party is transferring and the date of the transfer.
The amount of a directed contribution that is to be transferred to a leadership contestant is deemed to be a contribution made by the contributor to the contestant.

Any person who is authorized to accept contributions on behalf of a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant shall issue a receipt — of which the person shall keep a copy — for each contribution of more than $20 that they accept.

If anonymous contributions of $20 or less per person are collected in response to a general solicitation at a meeting or fundraising event related to the affairs of a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant, the person authorized to accept those contributions shall record the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the function at which the contributions were collected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the function;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the approximate number of people at the function; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total amount of the anonymous contributions received.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection 373(4), no individual shall make contributions that exceed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $1,500 in total in any calendar year to a particular registered party;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $1,500 in total in any calendar year to the registered associations, nomination contestants and candidates of a particular registered party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $1,500 in total to a candidate for a particular election who is not the candidate of a registered party; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: $1,500 in total in any calendar year to the leadership contestants in a particular leadership contest.

Subsection.Text: The contribution limits set out in subsection (1) increase by $25 on January 1 in each year.

A contribution may be made by way of a testamentary disposition if the contribution is made only in one calendar year and does not cause the contributor to exceed the relevant limit under subsection (1), taking into account any contributions that the contributor made before their death.

A testamentary disposition that provides for a contribution that would cause the contributor to exceed the relevant limit under subsection (1) shall be read as if the contribution is for the highest amount that would not cause the contributor to exceed that limit, and a testamentary disposition that provides for a contribution to be made in more than one calendar year after the year in which this subsection comes into force shall be read as if the contribution is to be made only in the first of those calendar years.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a contribution to a person who presents themselves as seeking the endorsement of a particular registered party is to be treated as a contribution referred to in paragraph (1)(b) to a candidate of that party and a contribution to a person who presents themselves as seeking to be a candidate not endorsed by any registered party is to be treated as a contribution referred to in paragraph (1)(c).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — nomination contestant’s contributions to own campaign
Subsection.Text: Contributions that do not exceed $1,000 in total by a nomination contestant out of their own funds to their own campaign as a nomination contestant do not count towards the nomination contestant’s contributions for the purposes of paragraph (1)(b).

Subject to subsection (7), no candidate in a particular election and no leadership contestant in a particular leadership contest shall make a contribution out of their own funds to their own campaign.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — certain contributions to own campaign
Subsection.Text: The following contributions are permitted:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contributions that do not exceed $5,000 in total by a candidate for a particular election out of their own funds to their own campaign; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contributions that do not exceed $25,000 in total by a leadership contestant in a particular leadership contest out of their own funds to their own campaign.

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: For greater certainty, contributions made by a candidate under subsection (1) to a registered party or a registered association that later transfers funds to the candidate for the purpose of their campaign do not have the effect of reducing the amount that the candidate may contribute under this subsection.

Subsection.Text: Contributions made under subsection (7) do not have the effect of reducing the amounts that the candidate or leadership contestant, as the case may be, may contribute under subsection (1) to other candidates or to other leadership contestants, as the case may be.
No person or entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: circumvent, or attempt to circumvent, the prohibition under subsection 363(1) or 367(6) or a limit set out in subsection 367(1) or (7) or section 371; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act in collusion with another person or entity for that purpose.

Subsection.Text: No person or entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conceal, or attempt to conceal, the identity of the source of a contribution governed by this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act in collusion with another person or entity for that purpose.

Subsection.Text: No person who is permitted to accept contributions under this Act shall accept a contribution that exceeds a limit under this Act.

No person or entity shall enter into an agreement for the provision for payment of goods or services, directly or indirectly, to a registered party or a candidate that includes a term that any individual will make a contribution, directly or indirectly, to a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant.

No person or entity shall solicit or accept a contribution on behalf of a registered party, a registered association or a candidate if the person or entity makes a representation to the contributor or potential contributor that part or all of the contribution would be transferred to a person or entity other than the registered party or a candidate, a leadership contestant or an electoral district association.
No person or entity shall act in collusion with another person or entity for the purpose of circumventing the prohibition under subsection (1).

No individual shall make a contribution to a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant that comes from money, property or the services of any person or entity that was provided to that individual for that purpose.

Despite subsection (1), a candidate or a leadership contestant may make a contribution under subsection 367(7) that comes from money provided by way of a loan to the candidate or leadership contestant made in writing by a financial institution as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act at a fair market rate of interest, as long as no security is given for the loan except property of the candidate or leadership contestant, as the case may be.

Section.Text: No individual shall, in respect of each contribution made under this Division, contribute cash in an amount that exceeds $20.

If a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant receives a contribution made in contravention of subsection 367(1) or (6) or 368(4) or section 370 or 371, the chief agent of the registered party, the financial agent of the registered association, the official agent of the candidate or the financial agent of the nomination contestant or leadership contestant, as the case may be, shall, within 30 days after becoming aware of the contravention, return the contribution unused to the contributor or, if that is not possible, pay the amount of it — or, in the case of a non-monetary contribution, an amount of money equal to its commercial value — to the Chief Electoral Officer, who shall forward that amount to the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: Except as permitted under this section, no person or entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make a loan to a registered party or a registered association;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: make a loan to a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant in relation to the contestant’s or candidate’s campaign; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: guarantee a loan referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

Subsection.Text: Except if the loan is permitted under this section, no registered agent of a registered party and no financial agent of a registered association shall borrow money on behalf of the party or association, and no official agent of a candidate and no financial agent of a nomination contestant or of a leadership contestant shall borrow money for the purposes of the candidate’s or contestant’s campaign.
A financial institution as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act may in writing make a loan referred to in subsection (1) at a fair market rate of interest.

An individual who is a Canadian citizen or is a permanent resident as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act may in writing make a loan referred to in subsection (1) or guarantee such a loan. However, the total of the following amounts shall not at any time exceed the individual’s relevant contribution limit set out in paragraphs 367(1)(a) to (d), subsection 367(5) and paragraphs 367(7)(a) and (b):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts of the individual’s contributions,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts of the individual’s loans made in the relevant contribution period, not including any amount that has been repaid in the calendar year in which the loan was made, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts guaranteed by the individual in the relevant contribution period, not including any amount for which the individual has ceased to be liable in the calendar year in which the guarantee was given.

Subsection.Text: A loan may be made in writing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by a registered party to a registered association of the party or a candidate endorsed by the party; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a registered association to the registered party with which it is affiliated, another registered association of the party or a candidate endorsed by the party.

Subsection.Text: A registered party or registered association may in writing guarantee a loan made in writing to a party, association or candidate to which it itself is permitted to make a loan under subsection (5).

Section.Text: No individual shall make a loan to a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant that is made possible by money, property or the services of any person or entity that was provided to that individual for that purpose.

Subsection.Text: A nomination campaign expense of a nomination contestant is an expense reasonably incurred as an incidence of the nomination contest, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a nomination contest expense;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a litigation expense;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: travel and living expenses;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a personal expense; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any fees of an auditor appointed under subsection 476.77(1) that have not been reimbursed by the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, none of the following is a nomination campaign expense:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any administrative monetary penalty imposed under Part 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under a compliance agreement entered into under Part 19 solely as a result of that compliance agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under an undertaking provided under Part 19 solely as a result of that undertaking.

Subsection.Text: A nomination contest expense is any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any cost incurred, or non-monetary contribution received, by a nomination contestant, to the extent that the property or service that the cost was incurred for or that was received as a non-monetary contribution is used to directly promote or oppose a nomination contestant during a nomination contest; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any acceptance by a nomination contestant of a provision of goods or services that is permitted under paragraph 364(2)(c), to the extent that the goods or services are used to directly promote or oppose a nomination contestant during a nomination contest.

Subsection.Text: Expenses for a fundraising activity, other than expenses referred to in paragraphs (3)(a) and (b) that are related to that activity, are not nomination contest expenses under subsection (1).
A nomination contest expense includes a cost incurred for, a non-monetary contribution in relation to, or a provision of goods and services in relation to,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the production of advertising or promotional material;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the distribution, broadcast or publication of such material in any media or by any other means during the nomination contest, including by the use of a capital asset;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the payment of remuneration and expenses to or on behalf of a person for their services as a financial agent or in any other capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: securing a meeting space or the supply of light refreshments at meetings;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any product or service provided by a government, a Crown corporation or any other public agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the conduct of surveys or research during a nomination contest.

Subsection.Text: In this section, cost incurred means an expense that is incurred by a nomination contestant, whether it is paid or unpaid.

Section.Text: A litigation expense of a nomination contestant is an expense of the contestant related to an application to a judge made under this Part, including an expense related to any appeal or judicial review arising from the application.

Subsection.Text: A nomination contestant’s personal expenses include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: childcare expenses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: expenses relating to the provision of care for a person with a physical or mental incapacity for whom the contestant normally provides such care; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a contestant who has a disability, additional expenses that are related to the disability.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusions — travel and living expenses, etc.
Subsection.Text: Neither litigation expenses nor travel and living expenses are personal expenses of a nomination contestant.
An electoral campaign expense of a candidate is an expense reasonably incurred as an incidence of the election, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an election expense;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a litigation expense;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: travel and living expenses;

Paragraph.Label: (a.3)
Paragraph.Text: an accessibility expense;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a personal expense; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any fees of an auditor appointed under subsection 477.1(2) that have not been reimbursed by the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, none of the following is an electoral campaign expense:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any administrative monetary penalty imposed under Part 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under a compliance agreement entered into under Part 19 solely as a result of that compliance agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under an undertaking provided under Part 19 solely as a result of that undertaking.

Subsection.Text: An election expense is any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any cost incurred, or non-monetary contribution received, by a registered party or a candidate, to the extent that the property or service that the cost was incurred for or that was received as a non-monetary contribution is used to directly promote or oppose a registered party, its leader or a candidate during an election period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any acceptance by a registered party or a candidate of a provision of goods or services that is permitted under subsection 364(2), to the extent that the goods or services are used to directly promote or oppose a registered party, its leader or a candidate during an election period.

Subsection.Text: Expenses for a fundraising activity and expenses to directly promote the nomination of a person as a candidate or the selection of a person as leader of a registered party, other than expenses referred to in paragraphs (3)(a) and (b) that are related to such fundraising and promotional activities, are not election expenses under subsection (1).
An election expense referred to in subsection (1) includes a cost incurred for, a non-monetary contribution in relation to, or a provision of goods and services in relation to,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the production of advertising or promotional material;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the distribution, broadcast or publication of such material in any media or by any other means during the election period, including by the use of a capital asset;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the payment of remuneration and expenses to or on behalf of a person for their services as an official agent or registered agent or in any other capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: securing a meeting space or the supply of light refreshments at meetings;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any product or service provided by a government, a Crown corporation or any other public agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the conduct of election surveys or other surveys or research during an election period.

Subsection.Text: An accessibility expense of a registered party or a candidate, as the case may be, is not an election expense of that party or candidate.
In subsection (1), cost incurred means an expense that is incurred by a registered party or a candidate, whether it is paid or unpaid.

Section.Text: A partisan advertising expense of a registered party or an electoral district association of a registered party, as the case may be, includes any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any non-monetary contribution received by the party or association, to the extent that the property or service that was received as a non-monetary contribution is used in relation to the production of a partisan advertising message or the transmission of a partisan advertising message to the public; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any acceptance by the party or association of a provision of goods or services that is permitted under subsection 364(2), to the extent that the goods or services are used in relation to the production of a partisan advertising message or the transmission of a partisan advertising message to the public.

Subsection.Text: If a fundraising activity is held for the primary purpose of soliciting a monetary contribution for a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant by way of selling a ticket, the amount of the monetary contribution received is the difference between the price of the ticket and the fair market value of what the ticket entitles the bearer to obtain.
For the purpose of subsection (1), in calculating what a ticket bearer is entitled to obtain, to be included in the calculation is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cost of any goods or services received by the ticket bearer personally, such as meals and promotional products; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their share of any general expenses incurred by the registered party, registered association, nomination contestant, candidate or leadership contestant, as the case may be, in holding the activity, such as expenses incurred for the rental of a meeting space or for any audiovisual equipment used.

Section.Text: A litigation expense of a candidate is an expense of the candidate related to any of the following requests or applications, including an expense related to any appeal or judicial review arising from the request or the application:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a request or an application made under Part 14;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an application to a judge made under this Part; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an application to contest the election in the candidate’s electoral district.

Subsection.Text: An accessibility expense of a registered party or a candidate, as the case may be, is any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any cost incurred, or non-monetary contribution received, by the party or candidate, to the extent that the property or service that the cost was incurred for — or that was received as a non-monetary contribution — is used solely to make accessible, to persons with a disability, materials used or activities held during an election period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the difference between the amounts referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), to the extent that the amount referred to in subparagraph (i) is greater than the amount referred to in subparagraph (ii):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of any cost incurred, or non-monetary contribution received, by the party or candidate, to the extent that the property or service that the cost was incurred for — or that was received as a non-monetary contribution — is used for materials used or activities held during an election period and those materials or activities are accessible to persons with a disability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount equal to the value of the property or service if the materials or activities had not been accessible to persons with a disability;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount equal to the value of goods or services referred to in subsection 364(2) that are accepted by the party or candidate, to the extent that the goods or services are used solely to make accessible, to persons with a disability, materials used or activities held during an election period; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the difference between the amounts referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), to the extent that the amount referred to in subparagraph (i) is greater than the amount referred to in subparagraph (ii):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount equal to the value of goods or services referred to in subsection 364(2) that are accepted by the party or candidate, to the extent that the goods or services are used for materials used or activities held during an election period and those materials or activities are accessible to persons with a disability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount equal to the value of the goods or services if the materials or activities had not been accessible to persons with a disability.

Subsection.Text: An amount referred to in subsection (1) that is related to a fundraising activity, to the nomination of a person as a candidate or to the selection of a person as leader of a registered party is not an accessibility expense.
In subsection (1), cost incurred means an expense that is incurred by a registered party or a candidate, whether it is paid or unpaid.
A candidate’s personal expenses include

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: childcare expenses;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: expenses relating to the provision of care for a person with a physical or mental incapacity for whom the candidate normally provides such care; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a candidate who has a disability, additional expenses that are related to the disability.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exclusions — travel and living expenses, etc.
Subsection.Text: Neither litigation expenses nor travel and living expenses are personal expenses of a candidate.

Section.MarginalNote: Categories of certain expenses and maximums
Section.Text: The Chief Electoral Officer may establish, in respect of candidates, categories of personal expenses and of travel and living expenses and may fix maximum amounts of expenses that may be incurred in each category.
Any expenses of a candidate that are incurred to remunerate the candidate’s representatives referred to in subsection 136(1) or 237.1(2) are deemed to be personal expenses of the candidate.

Subsection.Text: A leadership campaign expense of a leadership contestant is an expense reasonably incurred as an incidence of the leadership contest, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a leadership contest expense;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a litigation expense;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: travel and living expenses;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a personal expense; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any fees of an auditor appointed under Division 6 of Part 18 that have not been reimbursed by the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, none of the following is a leadership campaign expense:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any administrative monetary penalty imposed under Part 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under a compliance agreement entered into under Part 19 solely as a result of that compliance agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any amount that is required to be paid under an undertaking provided under Part 19 solely as a result of that undertaking.

Subsection.Text: A leadership contest expense is any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
