Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, eligible party, registered association, nomination contestant, potential candidate, candidate or third party that is required to register under subsection 349.6(1) or 353(1), contravenes section 325.2 (failure to provide information about self);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes subsection 326(1) or (2) (failure to provide election survey information) or (2.1) (failure to ensure sponsor of election survey notified of date of transmission of election survey results) or, being a sponsor of an election survey, contravenes subsection 326(3) (failure to ensure report on election survey results is published); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes section 327 (failure to indicate survey not based on recognized statistical methods).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a landlord or a condominium corporation, wilfully contravenes section 322 (prohibition of election advertising posters on residential premises); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes section 325 (removal of election advertising).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Offences requiring intent — fine only, summary conviction
Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being the owner or operator of an online platform, knowingly contravenes subsection 325.1(2) or (4) (failure to publish registry of partisan advertising messages and election advertising messages for required publication period) or subsection 325.1(5) (failure to keep information for required period);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 326(1) or (2) (failure to provide election survey information) or (2.1) (failure to ensure sponsor of election survey notified of date of transmission of election survey results) or, being a sponsor of an election survey, knowingly contravenes subsection 326(3) (failure to ensure report on election survey results is published);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully contravenes section 327 (failure to indicate survey not based on recognized statistical methods);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully contravenes subsection 328(2) (transmission of election survey results during blackout period);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully contravenes subsection 330(1) or (2) (foreign broadcasting);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a broadcaster, wilfully contravenes subsection 335(1) or, being a network operator, wilfully contravenes subsection 335(2) (failure to make broadcasting time available);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a broadcaster, wilfully contravenes subsection 339(3) (failure to make additional broadcasting time available) or 339(4) (failure to adjust broadcasting time) or, being a network operator, wilfully contravenes subsection 345(1) (failure to make free broadcasting time available);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully contravenes section 348 (failure to charge lowest rate for broadcasting time or advertising space);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a broadcaster or a network operator, fails to comply with an allocation of or entitlement to broadcasting time under this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a broadcaster or a network operator, makes available to a registered party or eligible party within the period described in subsection 335(1) more broadcasting time than is required to be made available by it to that party by an allocation under sections 337 and 338 or entitlement under section 339, without making available to each other registered party or eligible party an amount of additional equivalent broadcasting time that is based on the percentage of broadcasting time made available to it by the original allocation or entitlement.

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 323(1) (conducting election advertising during blackout period);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, eligible party, registered association, nomination contestant, potential candidate, candidate or third party that is required to register under subsection 349.6(1) or 353(1), knowingly contravenes section 325.2 (failure to provide information about self); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 328(1) (causing transmission of election survey results during blackout period).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 2 of Part 16.1 (Scripts and Recordings)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a calling service provider, contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.16(a) (obligation to keep scripts);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.16(b) (obligation to keep recordings); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.16(c) (obligation to keep list of telephone numbers called).

Subsection.Text: Every person who, being a calling service provider, knowingly contravenes any provision referred to in subsection (1) is guilty of an offence.
Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a person or group, contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.17(a) or 348.19(a) (obligation to keep scripts);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.17(b) or 348.18(a) (obligation to keep recordings); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 348.17(c), 348.18(b) or 348.19(b) (obligation to keep list of telephone numbers called).

Subsection.Text: Every person who, being a person or group, knowingly contravenes any provision referred to in subsection (1) is guilty of an offence.

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Part 17 (Third Party Advertising, Partisan Activities and Election Surveys)
Offences under Division 0.1 of Part 17 (Prohibition on Use of Foreign Funds by Third Parties)

Subsection.Text: Every third party is guilty of an offence who contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 349.02 (use of foreign contributions); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 349.03(a) (circumventing prohibition) or 349.03(b) (colluding to circumvent prohibition).

Subsection.Text: Every third party who knowingly contravenes any provision referred to in subsection (1) is guilty of an offence.

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 1 of Part 17 (Partisan Activities, Partisan Advertising and Election Surveys During Pre-election Period)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a third party, contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of subsections 349.1(1) to (3) (exceeding pre-election period expenses limits);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 349.4 (foreign third party incurring pre-election period expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section 349.5 (failure to identify self in advertising);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 349.6(1) (failure to register);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section 349.7 (failure to appoint financial agent) or subsection 349.8(1) (failure to appoint auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 349.91(1) or 349.92(1) (failure to file interim third-party expenses return) or 349.91(10) (failure to provide documents evidencing expenses on request);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 349.93(b) (filing interim third-party expenses return that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section 349.94 (use of anonymous contributions).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes any of subsections 349.1(1) to (3) or section 349.2 (exceeding or circumventing pre-election period expenses limits);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 349.3(1) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or potential candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 349.3(2) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or official agent of a potential candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 349.3(3) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes section 349.4 (foreign third party incurring pre-election period expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 349.6(1) (failure to register);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 349.7(2) or 349.8(3) (ineligible person acting as financial agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 349.91(1) or 349.92(1) (failure to file interim third-party expenses return); or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, contravenes paragraph 349.93(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 349.93(b) (filing interim third-party expenses return that contains false or misleading information or one that is incomplete).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 2 of Part 17 (Partisan Activities, Election Advertising and Election Surveys During Election Period)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a third party, contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of subsections 350(1) to (4) (exceeding election period expenses limits);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: section 351.1 (foreign third party incurring election period expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 352 (failure to identify self in advertising);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 353(1) (failure to register);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section 354 (failure to appoint financial agent) or subsection 355(1) (failure to appoint auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 357.01(1) or 357.02(1) (failure to file interim third-party expenses return) or 357.01(10) (failure to provide documents evidencing expenses on request);

Paragraph.Label: (d.2)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 357.03(b) (filing interim third-party expenses return that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section 357.1 (use of anonymous contributions).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes any of subsections 350(1) to (4) or section 351 (exceeding or circumventing election period expenses limits);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 351.01(1) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 351.01(2) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party or official agent of a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 351.01(3) (colluding to influence third party);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes section 351.1 (foreign third party incurring election period expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 353(1) (failure to register);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 354(2) or 355(3) (ineligible person acting as financial agent or auditor); or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 357.01(1) or 357.02(1) (failure to file interim third-party expenses return); or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, contravenes paragraph 357.03(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 357.03(b) (filing interim third-party expenses return that contains false or misleading information or one that is incomplete).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 3 of Part 17 (Third Parties’ Bank Accounts, Registry of Third Parties and Third-Party Expenses Returns)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a third party, contravenes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 358.1 (failure to satisfy bank account requirements);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 359(1) (failure to file third-party expenses return) or 359(9) (failure to provide documents evidencing expenses on request);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 359.1(b) (filing third-party expenses return that is substantially incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 361(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised return within specified period); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 361.2(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised return within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who, being a third party,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 359(1) (failure to file third-party expenses return);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes paragraph 359.1(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 359.1(b) (filing third-party expenses return that contains false or misleading information or one that is incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 361(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised return within specified period); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 361.2(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised return within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 1 of Part 18 (General Financial Provisions)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 363(1) (making contribution while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being the chief agent of a registered party, the financial agent of a registered association, the official agent of a candidate or the financial agent of a nomination contestant or leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 363(2) (failure to return or pay amount of ineligible contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 364(9) (paying convention fees while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or an electoral district association of one, contravenes subsection 365(1) (making prohibited transfer);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a person who is authorized to accept contributions on behalf of a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant, contravenes section 366 (failure to issue receipt);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 368(1) (circumventing contribution limit);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 368(2) (concealing source of contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, contravenes section 370 (making indirect contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a person authorized under this Act to accept contributions, contravenes section 372 (failure to return or pay amount of contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 373(1) or (2) (making a loan, guaranteeing a loan or borrowing money);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, contravenes section 374 (making indirect loans);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes subsection 380(1) or (2) (failure to document payment); or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being a person authorized to pay petty expenses, contravenes subsection 381(3) (failure to provide documentation of petty expenses) or 381(4) (paying more than the maximum amount of petty expenses).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 363(1) (making contribution while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or an electoral district association of one, knowingly contravenes subsection 365(1) (making prohibited transfer);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person who is authorized to accept contributions on behalf of a registered party, a registered association, a nomination contestant, a candidate or a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes section 366 (failure to issue receipt);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, knowingly contravenes subsection 367(1) or (6) (exceeding contribution limit);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 368(1) (circumventing contribution limit);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 368(2) (concealing source of contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a person entitled to accept contributions under this Act, knowingly contravenes subsection 368(3) (accepting excessive contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 368(4) (entering prohibited agreement);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 369(1) (soliciting or accepting contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 369(2) (collusion);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, knowingly contravenes section 370 (making indirect contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, knowingly contravenes section 371 (exceeding cash contribution limit);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being a person authorized under this Act to accept contributions, knowingly contravenes section 372 (failure to return or pay amount of contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 373(1) or (2) (making a loan, guaranteeing a loan or borrowing money); or

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being an individual, knowingly contravenes section 374 (making indirect loans).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 1.1 of Part 18 (Regulated Fundraising Events)

Section.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 384.2(1) or (4) (failure to publish information about regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 384.2(3) (failure to provide information about regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 384.2(4.1) (failure to notify Chief Electoral Officer of regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 384.2(5) or (7) (failure to replace old information about regulated fundraising event on its Internet site);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 384.2(6) (failure to provide new information about regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 384.3(1), (6) or (6.1) (failure to provide report on regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 384.3(3) (including prohibited name or address in report on regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 384.3(4), (4.1), (9) or (9.1) (failure to provide information about regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 384.3(5) or (10) (including prohibited name or address in information about regulated fundraising event);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 384.3(8) or (8.1) (failure to provide report on all regulated fundraising events);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 384.3(12) (including prohibited name or address in report on all regulated fundraising events);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being the chief agent of a registered party, the financial agent of a registered association, the official agent of a candidate or the financial agent of a nomination contestant or leadership contestant, contravenes section 384.4 (failure to return or pay amount of contribution); or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent or the leader of a registered party, contravenes subsection 384.7(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised report within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 2 of Part 18 (Political Parties)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes section 392 (failure to provide statement of assets and liabilities or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 396(2) or, being a registered party or an eligible party, contravenes subsection 395(4), section 399, subsection 400(1) or (2) or section 401 (failure to comply with requirements re: officers, chief agent, registered agents or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 405(1) or (4) (failure to report changes to registered party information);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes section 407 (failure to confirm validity of information on party);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent of a deregistered political party, contravenes section 420 (failure to provide financial transactions return or election expenses return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent of a merging registered party, contravenes section 424 (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes section 428 (failure to pay recoverable claim within three years);

Paragraph.Label: (g.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 429.2(1) (exceeding partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (g.2)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 429.2(2) (circumventing partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (g.3)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, contravenes subsection 429.2(3) (colluding to circumvent partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (g.4)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or a person acting on behalf of a registered party, contravenes section 429.3 (failure to indicate authority for partisan advertising);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 431(1) (exceeding election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, contravenes subsection 431(2) (colluding to circumvent election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 432(1), (2), (3) or (5) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes section 433 (failure to provide quarterly return);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered agent, contravenes section 434 (failure to pay excess contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes paragraph 436(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 437(1), (2) or (3) (failure to provide election expenses return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes paragraph 439(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes subsection 440(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent or the leader of a registered party, contravenes subsection 442(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period); or

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being the chief executive officer of a provincial division, contravenes subsection 446(5) (failure to report provincial division changes).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a registered agent or a person authorized under subsection 381(1), knowingly contravenes subsection 426(1) or (2) (paying or incurring registered party’s expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a registered agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 426(3) (accepting contributions or borrowing while ineligible); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a registered agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 426(4) (while ineligible, accepting provision of goods or services or transfer of funds or providing goods or services or transferring funds).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, knowingly contravenes section 392 (failure to provide statement of assets and liabilities or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 403(1), (2) or (3) (ineligible person acting as officer, chief agent, registered agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being an officer of a party, contravenes section 404 (officer knowing party not a political party);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a leader of a party, contravenes subsection 408(1), (3) or (4) (providing or certifying false or misleading information or making false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or an eligible party, contravenes subsection 408(2) (providing false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes subsection 408(5) (making false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent of a deregistered political party, knowingly contravenes section 420 (failure to provide transactions return or election expenses return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent of a merging registered party, knowingly contravenes section 424 (failure to provide financial transactions returns or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered agent other than the chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 426(2.1) (failure to obtain written authorization to incur registered party’s expenses or incurring them contrary to authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (h.2)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 429.2(1) (exceeding partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h.3)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 429.2(2) (circumventing partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h.4)
Paragraph.Text: being a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 429.2(3) (colluding to circumvent partisan advertising expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 431(1) (exceeding election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or a third party, knowingly contravenes subsection 431(2) (colluding to circumvent election expense limit);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 432(1), (2), (3) or (5) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes section 433 (failure to provide quarterly return);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered agent, knowingly contravenes section 434 (failure to pay excess contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes paragraph 436(a) (providing document that contains false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 437(1), (2) or (3) (failure to provide election expenses return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, contravenes paragraph 439(a) (providing document that contains false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 440(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period); or

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being a chief agent or the leader of a registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 442(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 3 of Part 18 (Electoral District Associations)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association of a registered party, contravenes section 447 (financial activity while unregistered);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association of a registered party, contravenes subsection 449.1(1) (incurring certain partisan advertising expenses or, during a pre-election period, transmitting certain partisan advertising messages);

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes section 449.2 (failure to indicate authority for partisan advertising);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association of a registered party, contravenes subsection 450(1) (incurring election expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes section 451 (failure to provide statement of assets and liabilities or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes section 452 (making erroneous declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes subsection 456(2) (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of electoral district agent);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes section 459, 460 or 461 (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of financial agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes subsection 463(1) (failure to report changes to registered association information);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, contravenes section 464 (failure to confirm validity of information concerning association);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a deregistered electoral district association, contravenes section 473 (failure to provide financial transactions return for fiscal period or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes section 475.2 (failure to pay recoverable claim within three years);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes subsection 475.4(1), (2), (3) or (5) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes section 475.5 (failure to pay excess contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes paragraph 475.7(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes subsection 475.9(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period); or

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent or the chief executive officer of a registered association, contravenes subsection 475.92(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than an electoral district agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475(1) or (2) (paying or incurring registered association’s expenses while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than an electoral district agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475(3) (accepting contributions while ineligible); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than the financial agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475(4) (while ineligible, accepting provision of goods or services or transfer of funds or providing goods or services or transferring funds).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association, knowingly contravenes section 447 (financial activity while unregistered);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association of a registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 449.1(1) (incurring certain partisan advertising expenses or, during a pre-election period, transmitting certain partisan advertising messages);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being an electoral district association of a registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 450(1) (incurring election expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, knowingly contravenes section 451 (failure to provide statement of assets and liabilities or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes section 452 (making erroneous declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 456(2) (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of electoral district agent);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, knowingly contravenes subsection 462(1) or (2) (acting as financial agent, electoral district agent or auditor when ineligible to do so);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a deregistered electoral district association, knowingly contravenes section 473 (failure to provide financial transactions return for fiscal period or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475.4(1), (2), (3) or (5) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes section 475.5 (failure to pay excess contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, contravenes paragraph 475.7(a) (providing document that contains false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475.9(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period); or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent or chief executive officer of a registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 475.92(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 4 of Part 18 (Nomination Contestants)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or registered association, contravenes subsection 476.1(1) (failure to notify of nomination contest);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes section 476.3 (failure to appoint financial agent);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes section 476.5, 476.6 or 476.61 (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of financial agent);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.63(1) or (2) (failure to report changes in nomination contestant information);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes section 476.65 (failure to satisfy bank account requirements);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant or the financial agent of one, contravenes subsection 476.68(1) (exceeding nomination contest expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant or the financial agent of one, contravenes subsection 476.7(1) or (2) (failure to pay recoverable claim within three years or paying without authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.75(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide nomination campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 476.75(4);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.75(8) (failure to send declaration re: nomination campaign return to financial agent) or subsection 476.81(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: nomination campaign ret­urn);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.75(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.75(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 476.75(14);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes section 476.76 (failure to pay the value of contributions that cannot be returned);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.77(1) (failure to appoint auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.77(4) or (5) or section 476.78 (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (p.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.82(1) or (3) (failure to send written statement or advise financial agent);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.83(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant or the financial agent of one, contravenes subsection 476.85(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes paragraph 476.9(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes subsection 476.92(2) or (3) or section 476.93 (failure to dispose of surplus nomination campaign funds).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party or registered association, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.1(1) (failure to notify of nomination contest);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, knowingly contravenes section 476.62 (acting as financial agent when ineligible to do so);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.66(1) (acceptance of contribution while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.66(2) (while ineligible, accepting provision of goods or services or transfer of funds or transferring funds);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.66(3) (accepting prohibited contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.66(4), (5) or (6) (paying or incurring nomination campaign expenses while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant or the financial agent of one, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.68(1) (exceeding nomination contest expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, contravenes subsection 476.68(2) (circumventing nomination contest expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.75(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide nomination campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 476.75(4);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.75(8) (failure to send declaration re: nomination campaign return to financial agent) or subsection 476.81(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: nomination campaign return);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.75(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.75(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 476.75(14);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes section 476.76 (failure to pay the value of contributions that cannot be returned);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, knowingly contravenes section 476.79 (acting as auditor when ineligible to do so);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.83(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant or the financial agent of one, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.85(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (r.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a nomination contestant, contravenes section 476.891 (sending false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, contravenes paragraph 476.9(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 476.9(b) (providing document that contains false or misleading information or that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a nomination contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 476.92(2) or (3) or section 476.93 (failure to dispose of surplus nomination campaign funds).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.1(1) (failure to appoint official agent);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.1(2) (failure to appoint auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes section 477.42 (failure to appoint a replacement official agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes section 477.46 (failure to satisfy bank account requirements);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, an official agent or a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c), contravenes subsection 477.52(1) (exceeding election expenses limit) or, being a candidate, an official agent, a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c) or a third party, contravenes subsection 477.52(2) (colluding to circumvent election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.54(1) or (2) (failure to pay recoverable claim within three years or paying without authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.59(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide electoral campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 477.59(4);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.59(8) (failure to send declaration re: electoral campaign return to official agent) or subsection 477.63(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: electoral campaign return);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.59(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.59(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 477.59(14);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes section 477.61 (failure to pay value of contribution that cannot be returned);

Paragraph.Label: (m.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.64(1) or (3) (failure to send written statement or advise official agent);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.65(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or the official agent of one, contravenes subsection 477.67(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes paragraph 477.72(1)(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.81(2) or (3) or section 477.82 (failure to dispose of surplus electoral funds);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered agent or financial agent, contravenes section 477.85 (improper or unauthorized transfer of funds);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes subsection 477.88(2) (failure to return unused income tax receipts);

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.9(1) (accepting prohibited gift or other advantage);

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.9(5) (failure to provide statement within required period);

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 477.92(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised statement within 30-day period or any extension of that period); or

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes paragraph 477.95(b) (providing incomplete statement).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 477.44(1) or (2) (ineligible person acting as official agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(1) or (2) (accepting contributions or providing receipts for them);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(3) (while ineligible, accepting provision of goods or services or transfer of funds or providing goods or services or transferring funds);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(4) (paying electoral campaign expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a candidate, an official agent or a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c), knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(5) (incurring electoral campaign expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (d.2)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(5.1) (failure to obtain written authorization to incur election expense or incurring it contrary to authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a candidate or official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.47(6) (paying certain expenses);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, an official agent or a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c), knowingly contravenes subsection 477.52(1) (exceeding election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, an official agent, a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c) or a third party, contravenes subsection 477.52(2) (colluding to circumvent election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c), knowingly contravenes subsection 477.551 (entering into contract in relation to electoral campaign without authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.59(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide electoral campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 477.59(4);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.59(8) (failure to send declaration re: electoral campaign return to official agent) or subsection 477.63(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: electoral campaign return);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.59(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.59(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 477.59(14);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes section 477.61 (failure to pay value of contribution made by unknown contributor);

Paragraph.Label: (o.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.64(1) or (3) (failure to send written statement or advise official agent);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.65(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or the official agent of one, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.67(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (q.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes section 477.711 (sending false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, contravenes paragraph 477.72(1)(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 477.72(1)(b) (providing document that contains false or misleading statement or one that is incomplete);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.81(2) or (3) or section 477.82 (failure to dispose of surplus electoral funds);

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered agent or financial agent, knowingly contravenes section 477.85 (unauthorized or improper transfer of funds);

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.9(1) (accepting prohibited gift or other advantage);

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.9(5) (failure to provide statement within required period);

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.92(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised statement within 30-day period or any extension of that period); or

Paragraph.Label: (x)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes paragraph 477.95(a) (providing statement containing false or misleading information) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 477.95(b) (providing incomplete statement).

Heading.TitleText: Offences under Division 6 of Part 18 (Leadership Contestants)

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes subsection 478.1(1) or (2) (failure to inform of leadership contest or related changes);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, contravenes subsection 478.2(1) (failure to register for a leadership contest);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.5(2) or section 478.62, 478.63 or 478.64 (failure to comply with requirements re: appointment of leadership campaign agent, financial agent or auditor);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.66(1) or (2) (failure to report changes to leadership contestant information);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes section 478.67 (failure to file statement of withdrawal);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, contravenes section 478.68 (failure to file statement of withdrawal of acceptance);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes section 478.72 (failure to satisfy bank account requirements);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant or the financial agent of one, contravenes subsection 478.75(1) or (2) (failure to pay recoverable claim within three years or paying without authorization);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.8(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide leadership campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 478.8(4);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.8(8) (failure to send declaration re: leadership campaign return to financial agent) or subsection 478.84(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: leadership campaign return);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.8(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.8(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 478.8(14);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes any of subsections 478.81(1) to (3) (failure to provide return on contributions or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes section 478.82 (failure to forward certain contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (p.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.85(1) or (3) (failure to send written statement or advise financial agent);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.86(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant or the financial agent of one, contravenes subsection 478.88(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes paragraph 478.93(b) (providing document that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes subsection 478.95(2) or (3) or section 478.96 (failure to dispose of surplus leadership campaign funds).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.1(1) or (2) (failure to inform of leadership contest or related changes);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.2(1) (failure to register for a leadership contest);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a person, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.65(1) or (2) (acting as financial agent, leadership campaign agent or auditor when ineligible to do so);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes section 478.67 (failure to file statement of withdrawal);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a registered party, knowingly contravenes section 478.68 (failure to file statement of withdrawal of acceptance);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a leadership campaign agent, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.73(1) (acceptance of contribution while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity other than a leadership campaign agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.73(2) (while ineligible, accepting provision of goods or services or transfer of funds or transferring funds);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership campaign agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.73(3) (accepting prohibited contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.73(4) or (5) (paying or incurring expenses for specified purposes while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: being a person or entity, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.73(6) (paying certain expenses of leadership contestant while ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.8(1), (2), (5) or (7) (failure to provide leadership campaign return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 478.8(4);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.8(8) (failure to send declaration re: leadership campaign return to financial agent) or subsection 478.84(1) (failure to provide Chief Electoral Officer with declaration re: leadership campaign return);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.8(10) or (15) (failure to provide report on payment of claim);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.8(11) or (12) (failure to provide updated version of statement of unpaid claims);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Chief Electoral Officer under subsection 478.8(14);

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes any of subsections 478.81(1) to (3) (failure to provide return on contributions or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes section 478.82 (failure to forward certain contributions);

Paragraph.Label: (r.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.85(1) or (3) (failure to send written statement or advise financial agent);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.86(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within specified period);

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant or the financial agent of one, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.88(3) (failure to provide corrected or revised document within 30-day period or any extension of that period);

Paragraph.Label: (t.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a leadership contestant, contravenes section 478.921 (sending false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, contravenes paragraph 478.93(a) or knowingly contravenes paragraph 478.93(b) (providing document that contains false or misleading information or that is substantially incomplete); or

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: being the financial agent of a leadership contestant, knowingly contravenes subsection 478.95(2) or (3) or section 478.96 (failure to dispose of surplus leadership campaign funds).

Subsection.Text: Every chief agent of a registered party is guilty of an offence who fails to comply with a requirement of the Commissioner under section 510.001.
Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 479(4) (refusal to obey order to leave office or place); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being the chief agent of a registered party, knowingly fails to comply with a requirement of the Commissioner under section 510.001.

Subsection.Text: Every person who contravenes subsection 548(1) (removal of posted election documents) is guilty of an offence.
Every person is guilty of an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly contravenes subsection 549(3) (making false declaration in solemn declaration or affidavit) or 549(4) (compelling or inducing false declaration); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes section 550 (signing document that limits freedom of action in Parliament).

Subsection.Text: Every person who is guilty of an offence under any of subsections 484(1), 489(1), 491(1), 492(1), 495(1), 495.1(1), 495.2(1), 495.21(1), 495.3(1), 496(1), 496.1(1), 497(1), 497.1(1), 497.2(1), 497.3(1), 497.4(1), 497.5(1), 498(1) and 499(1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $2,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than three months, or to both.
Every person who is guilty of an offence under section 497.01 is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $1,000.

Every person who is guilty of an offence under any of subsections 484(2) and 486(2), paragraph 487(1)(a), subsections 488(1) and 489(2), sections 491.1 and 493 and subsections 495(2) and (3), 497.1(2) and 497.2(2) is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $5,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than six months, or to both.

Every person who is guilty of an offence under subsection 485(1) or paragraph 487(1)(b) is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $10,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than one year, or to both.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Punishment — offences requiring intent (summary conviction — fine only)
Subsection.Text: Every person who is guilty of an offence under subsection 495(4) is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $50,000.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on summary conviction, to a fine of not more than $20,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than one year, or to both; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of not more than $50,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years, or to both.

Subsection.Text: Every third party that is guilty of an offence under paragraph 495.21(1)(a) or (b) or subsection 495.21(2) is, in addition to the punishment provided under subsection (1) or (5), liable to a fine of up to five times the amount of the funds whose source was a foreign entity that were used, or the amount of the funds that were used to circumvent the prohibition on using funds whose source is a foreign entity.

Every third party that is guilty of an offence under paragraph 495.3(1)(a) or (2)(a) is, in addition to the punishment provided under subsection (1) or (5), liable to a fine of up to five times the amount by which the third party exceeded the pre-election period expenses limit in question.

Every third party that is guilty of an offence under paragraph 496(1)(a) or (2)(a) is, in addition to the punishment provided under subsection (1) or (5), liable to a fine of up to five times the amount by which the third party exceeded the election period expenses limit in question.

When a person has been convicted of an offence under this Act, the court may, having regard to the nature of the offence and the circumstances surrounding its commission, and in addition to any other punishment that may be imposed under this Act, by order direct the person to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: perform community service, subject to any reasonable conditions that may be specified in the order;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the offence results, directly or indirectly, in a financial benefit under this Act, or a contribution for which a receipt referred to in subsection 127(3) of the Income Tax Act was issued, pay to the Receiver General an amount that is not more than the financial benefit or contribution, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: compensate any other person who has suffered damages as a result of the commission of the offence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: perform any obligation the non-performance of which gave rise to the offence; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take any other reasonable measure that the court considers appropriate to ensure compliance with this Act.

Subsection.Text: If a registered party, its chief agent or registered agent or one of its officers has been convicted of an offence referred to in subsection (3), the court may, having regard to the nature of the offence and the circumstances surrounding its commission, and in addition to any other punishment that may be imposed under this Act, by order,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: direct the Chief Electoral Officer to deregister the party;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it directs deregistration under paragraph (a), direct the chief agent — or another person specified by the court — to liquidate the party’s assets; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it directs liquidation under paragraph (b), direct the financial agent of each registered association — or another person specified by the court — to liquidate the registered association’s assets.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (2), the provisions are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497(2)(h) (entering into prohibited agreement);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497(2)(i) (soliciting or accepting contribution);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497(2)(j) (collusion);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.1(3)(d) (providing or certifying false or misleading information or making false or misleading declaration);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.1(3)(e) (providing false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.1(3)(k) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.1(3)(n) (providing document that contains false or misleading information);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.1(3)(p) (providing document that contains false or misleading information); and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 497.2(3)(h) (failure to provide financial transactions return or related documents).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Documents to be provided to Chief Electoral Officer
Subsection.Text: The chief agent or specified person shall, within six months after being directed to liquidate the party’s assets under subsection (2), provide to the Chief Electoral Officer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement — prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles — of the fair market value of the party’s assets and liabilities on the day of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a report by the party’s auditor to the chief agent or specified person containing the auditor’s opinion as to whether the statement presents, in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards, the fair market value of those assets and liabilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration in the prescribed form by the chief agent or specified person concerning that statement.

Subsection.Text: Within three months after providing the documents referred to in subsection (4), the chief agent or specified person shall remit an amount equal to any net balance of the assets over liabilities, calculated on the basis of the statement mentioned in paragraph (4)(a), to the Chief Electoral Officer who shall forward that amount to the Receiver General.
The chief agent or specified person is liable for the remittance of the amount referred to in subsection (5).

Subsections (4) to (6) apply to the liquidation of a registered association’s assets under subsection (2) and any reference in those subsections to “party” and “chief agent” shall be read as a reference to “registered association” and “financial agent”, respectively.
Every person is guilty of an offence that is an illegal practice who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, contravenes section 92 (publication of false statement of withdrawal of candidate);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent, contravenes subsection 330(2) (foreign broadcasting);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being an official agent, a candidate or a person authorized under paragraph 477.55(c), knowingly contravenes section 477.52 (exceeding election expenses limit);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, commits an offence under subsection 480(1) (obstructing electoral process) or 480(2) (inciting, conspiring to act in disorderly manner);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes subsection 549(3) (making false declaration in solemn declaration or affidavit) or 549(4) (compelling or inducing false declaration); or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, contravenes section 550 (signing of document that limits freedom of action in Parliament).

Subsection.Text: Every person is guilty of an offence that is a corrupt practice who

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, contravenes paragraph 43(a) (obstruction of election officer);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, knowingly contravenes paragraph 43(b) (impersonation of election officer);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, contravenes paragraph 56(b) (making false statement to have person deleted from Register of Electors);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, contravenes paragraph 56(c) or (d) (forbidden acts re Register of Electors);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes section 89 (signing of nomination paper when ineligible);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes paragraph 111(a), (d) or (e) (forbidden acts re list of electors);

Paragraph.Label: (g.1)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes section 281.5 (only one vote);

Paragraph.Label: (g.2)
Paragraph.Text: contravenes paragraph 281.7(1)(a) (request or apply for a ballot or special ballot under false name);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, commits an offence under subsection 282.7(1) (offering bribe);

Paragraph.Label: (h.01)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate, knowingly contravenes subsection 477.9(1) (accepting prohibited gift or other advantage);

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, commits an offence under subsection 480.1(1) (impersonation); or

Paragraph.Label: (h.2)
Paragraph.Text: being a candidate or an official agent of a candidate, commits an offence under section 482.1 (obstruction).

Subsection.Text: Any person who is convicted of having committed an offence that is an illegal practice or a corrupt practice under this Act shall, in addition to any other punishment for that offence prescribed by this Act, in the case of an illegal practice, during the next five years or, in the case of a corrupt practice, during the next seven years, after the date of their being so convicted, not be entitled to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be elected to or sit in the House of Commons; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: hold any office in the nomination of the Crown or of the Governor in Council.

Subsection.Text: A political party that is deregistered during a pre-election period does not commit an offence under paragraph 495.3(1)(a) or (2)(a) if, before the deregistration, its partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses and election survey expenses exceeded any maximum amount set out in section 349.1.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prior expenses applied against spending limit
Subsection.Text: If subsection (1) applies, then partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses and election survey expenses incurred before the deregistration shall be applied against any maximum amount set out in section 349.1 and, if the limit is exceeded, the political party shall not incur any additional partisan activity expenses, partisan advertising expenses or election survey expenses.

A political party that is deregistered during an election period does not commit an offence under paragraph 496(1)(a) or (2)(a) if, before the deregistration, its partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses exceeded any maximum amount set out in section 350.

An eligible party that does not become a registered party during the election period of a general election does not commit an offence under paragraph 496(1)(a) or (2)(a) if its partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses, as of the day that it is informed under subsection 390(4) that it has not been registered, exceed any maximum amount set out in section 350.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prior expenses applied against spending limit
Subsection.Text: If subsection (1.2) or (2) applies, then partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses and election survey expenses incurred before the deregistration or before the day referred to in subsection (2), as the case may be, shall be applied against any maximum amount set out in section 350 and, if the maximum amount is exceeded, the party shall not incur any additional partisan activity expenses, election advertising expenses or election survey expenses.

Section.Text: In the case of judicial proceedings or a compliance agreement involving an eligible party, a registered party, a deregistered political party or an electoral district association,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the party or association is deemed to be a person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any act or thing done or omitted to be done by an officer, a chief agent or other registered agent of the party, or by an officer, the financial agent or other electoral district agent of the association within the scope of their authority to act, is deemed to be an act or thing done or omitted to be done by the party or association, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: If a third party that is a group commits an offence under paragraph 495(1)(a.2) or 495(5)(a.1) or section 495.21, 495.3, 496 or 496.1, the person who is responsible for the group or its financial agent commits the offence if the person or financial agent authorized, consented to or participated in the act or omission that constitutes the offence.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prosecution of third parties — vicarious liability
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of a prosecution brought against a third party under paragraph 495(1)(a.2) or 495(5)(a.1) or section 495.21, 495.3, 496 or 496.1, the third party is deemed to be a person and any act or omission of the person who signed the application for registration in respect of the third party — or, in the absence of an application, the person who would have signed it — or the third party’s financial agent, within the scope of that person’s or financial agent’s authority, is deemed to be an act or omission of the third party.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prosecution of third parties — groups or corporations ($50,000)
